Testing Code Documentation¶

agenttesting.py – Test Agent and Master API¶

This module performs an array of unit tests across the platform. In general, all modules involving human interaction immediately pass the user input to a new module or class or function. This affords our testing suite the flexibility to simulate human interaction by mimicking the inputs by passing them in directly. It is not considered necessary to test the input() method itself, and user inputs lack complexity that warrants testing beyond user testing. It also includes integration tests - essentially this is a cascade of tests that begin by testing the data structures, then testing endpoints for data and migrating further from these end points. For example, first the dicionary creator class is tested (input validation, dictionary return validity, internal data modification methods), then a socket connection is validated, then a dictionary is sent via sockets with the return unvalidated, then the return is validated, and finally the simulations of user input which itself generated a dictionary which is then passed to the socket and validated by the server and returned is validated.

class agenttesting.TestAgentData(methodName='runTest')¶

This class tests the agentdata module.

Warning

Do not use helper functions to create a dictionary.

setUp()¶

Set Data to be converted and validated.

test_data_integrity()¶

Tests the data returned.

test_date_converter()¶

Tests the conversion of dates for JSON transport through sockets.

class agenttesting.TestInvalidAction(methodName='runTest')¶

This class tests edge cases resulting in an invalid action Basically send a random integer as the action that is not one of the accepted actions.

setUp()¶

It is necessary to instantiate the data classes and extract the relevant dictionaries.

test_invalid_action()¶

Vary loops through this to vary the extensiveness of the test.

class agenttesting.TestSocketConnection(methodName='runTest')¶

This class tests socketconnection and by implication, also tests socketresponder and masterpiresponder. As such, it tests the raw socket, and requires database interaction to pass.

Warning

Some of these tests will FAIL if testing on the actual database unless the database is updated with the requisite bookings.

Note

These tests will also fail, as will tests that refer to this class in the comments if TestAgentData fails.

setUp()¶

It is necessary to instantiate the true data class and extract the relevant dictionary. A valid socket connection is also required.

test_socket_conn_false()¶

Test the connection responds to invalid but correctly formatted data.

test_socket_conn_true()¶

Test the connection

class agenttesting.TestSocketResponseAction1(methodName='runTest')¶

As in TestSocketConnection by implication, but this tests the conditional return of the socketindependent of validation on the AgentPi. The purpose is to edge cases where a single value in the dictionary should determine the result of processing the entire dictionary. Essentially this ensures that only fully valid dictionaries will yield a positive response. Test a dictionary that has all but one parameter correct. These should return a dictionary with None, which is returned to the test as False. i.e., invalid booking details.

setUp()¶

It is necessary to instantiate the data classes and extract the relevant dictionaries. It additionally requires a socket connection.

test_a1_invalid_car_id()¶

Test an incorrect car_id

test_a1_invalid_info_date_time()¶

Test an incorrect date - will fail unless Master is connected to database.

test_a1_invalid_password()¶

Test an incorrect password

test_a1_invalid_username()¶

Test an incorrect username

test_a1_invalid_usertoken()¶

Test an incorrect usertoken - this should return a valid dictionary.

class agenttesting.TestSocketResponseAction2(methodName='runTest')¶

As :class:TestSocketResponseAction1`, but for action 2 (validating a face recognition) Test a dictionary that has all but one parameter correct. These should return a dictionary with None, which is returned to the test as False. i.e., invalid booking details.

setUp()¶

It is necessary to instantiate the data classes and extract the relevant dictionaries. This test suite also requires a socket connection.

test_a2_invalid_car_id()¶

Test an incorrect car_id

test_a2_invalid_info_date_time()¶

Incorrect date - will fail unless Master is connected to database.

test_a2_invalid_password()¶

Incorrect password - should return a valid dictionary.

test_a2_invalid_username()¶

Incorrect username - should return a valid dictionary.

test_a2_invalid_usertoken()¶

Tests an incorrect usertoken.

class agenttesting.TestSocketValidation(methodName='runTest')¶

This tests the entry points of the validation methods of socketconnection. Essentially it interfaces directly with the functions that the user input is passed to. This checks for the appropriate responses with the minimal data required.

setUp()¶

It is necessary to instantiate the data classes and extract the relevant dictionaries. This testing suite requires two socket connections.

test_invalid_car_cred()¶

Test invalid car but valid credentials.

test_invalid_car_token()¶

Test invalid car but valid token.

test_invalid_cred()¶

Test invalid credential response.

test_invalid_token()¶

Test invalid token response.

test_valid_cred()¶

Test valid credential response.

test_valid_token()¶

Test valid token response.

class agenttesting.TestUtilities(methodName='runTest')¶

Primary testing class for utilities

setUp()¶

Create a location to test on.

test_utility_location_edges()¶

Test edge cases.

test_utility_return_types()¶

Validates the return types.

test_utility_size()¶

Test the location return types.

agenttesting.dictionary_class_helper_false() → agentdata.DictionaryConstructor¶

This helper functions return dictionary class objects for testing purposes populated by incorrect values. The only elements that does not change from a valid dictionary is the action. To build tests that look at each element of the object, set the value directly, changing the object by one keyvalue at time via class level function calls.

Note

This function returns an instantiation of a custom class - you must call the dictionary return function before passing to any socket calls.

agenttesting.dictionary_class_helper_true() → agentdata.DictionaryConstructor¶

This helper functions return dictionary class objects for testing purposes populated by correct values. To build tests that look at each element of the object, set the value directly, changing the object by one keyvalue at time via class level function calls.

Note

This function returns an instantiation of a custom class - you must call the dictionary return function before passing to any socket calls.

facetesting.py - Validates User Selection¶

class facetesting.TestFaceRecognition(methodName='runTest')¶

This class tests a face capture event - it requires tester interaction, active hardware, and takes approximately two minutes.

This testing class is structured in such a way as to test a non-working face database actively without compromising the existing face profiles. If it does however, it avoids collisions with the existing user base to maintain integrity by using different file structures that the primary software ignores. Modification of this is NOT RECOMMENDED. It is necessary for a face to be present to test. Also note that tests are order dependant and names as such. As such note that this test is monolithic in nature - Fail early, fail fast.

setUp()¶

Define all the variables for consistent testing across all functions.

test_01_face_is_present()¶

This will add the face to the test database. Test that a face is present and that adequate files are captured.

test_02_face_is_not_present()¶

Test the timeout and graceful return of a missing face.

test_03_encode_valid()¶

Encode the test faces just captured.

test_04_encode_invalid()¶

Encode the database of pre-existing faces. We reencode this each time incase the encoding library changes.

test_05_recog_valid()¶

Test face against database it does exist in.

test_06_unrecog_valid()¶

Test face against a database that it does not exist in, and the graveful return.
